meta.name: description
meta.content: South Side Bee Branch School District is a small school district located in Van Buren county in Arkansas. The school has approximately 500 students and is located on HWY 65 north of Greenbrier.

div.p: All softball games postponed until further notice.
All baseball games postponed until further notice.
Until further notice, the Old Gym and weight room will be open every Sunday from 2:00 - 4:00 pm and Tuesday from 7:00 - 9:00 pm.

Beginning Tuesday, March 9th, and running through Wednesday, May 6th, South Side High School is having an attendance competition between grades 7-11 to see which class can have the lowest percentage . . .
Help the school earn money by clipping box tops from a variety of products. Each box top earns the school 10 cents. Box tops can be turned into the elementary office. For more information visit . . .

div.class: custom_151477 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

p.span: Dear Seniors and Senior Parents,

The South Side Bee Branch School District understands this year has been unlike any other, and because of this, you have not had the ideal senior experience that you had hoped for. Special events and memorable moments have had to be put aside for the health and wellness of our community and our country, and it has affected each one of you. However, the district wants you to know that the Seniors of 2020 have not been forgotten, and members of the high school staff and administration are planning great things to honor and appreciate you this year.
Below is a list of activities the district has planned for you in the next few weeks that will, hopefully, give you the recognition you deserve until we get back to some type of normalcy:

On Monday the 20th, Wednesday the 22nd, and Friday the 24th, seniors can come to the school between the hours of 10 am -2 pm to clean out their lockers (both hallway and gym locker) and receive their cap and gowns. To keep with social distancing and safety regulations, it will go as follows:
- Students will drive under the awning on the north side of the high school building from the direction of the student parking lot

- The STUDENT ONLY can get out of the car and enter the building to clean out lockers. Please leave all textbooks in the locker and only take what belongs to you. There will be trash cans to throw away anything you need to get rid of.
- Coach Bradford and Mrs. Leonard will be there to help direct you and ensure social distancing.
- Once one student is finished and pulls away, the next student may park under the awning and enter the building.
- Please let us know if you absolutely cannot come on these days or during these hours so we can arrange for you a time to come when you are able to.

*Friday, April 24th - The Senior Slide Show and The Senior Awards that we know of right now will be released on Facebook (South Side Bee Branch School District, South Side High School, and SSBB Senior 2020, SSBB High School Counseling), school email, and the school website (www.southsidebb.org). Mrs. Wilson will be getting with each of you to make sure she has an accurate, up-to-date list of awards and recognition so far.

Sunday, May 3rd - We will be having a special recognition of seniors on their normally scheduled graduation day at 2:00. Details of what this will look like are being worked out right now, but you WILL have an activity for all seniors on this day. **Please know that this is NOT going to be your regular graduation ceremony. The district is still COMMITTED to having a traditional graduation ceremony when it is safe and allowed by our government and school officials at a future date to be determined. Once all details are worked out, information will be released to you about the ceremony that is planned for Sunday, May 3rd.
A senior cookout is being planned for a future date, when allowed, at the FFA Barn so that all seniors can get together and celebrate their friendship and great accomplishments.

The school district is committed to making your senior year special for you under these unusual circumstances. Even though it is different, the memories from this year and the experiences you are going through will be a part of history that you can share with future generations. South Side Seniors 2020 will go down in history.

div.class: custom_141828 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

p.span: Dear Parent/Guardian:

On Monday, April 6, Governor Asa Hutchinson announced that all Arkansas public schools will remain closed to on-site instruction for the 2019-20 school year. Consequently, learning will continue through alternative methods of instruction for the remainder of the year. Johnny Key, Secretary of the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education, stressed that schools should be flexible with the amount of work required and the scheduling of such work to not place an undue burden upon parents. Additionally, Secretary Key stated that no “new learning” should occur, rather schools should focus on the essential learnings that had been taught prior to the time of the school closure.

Over the next few days, teachers and administrators will be reaching out to our students and parents to determine who can fully participate in online instruction. This includes, but is not limited to, connectivity and access to appropriate devices. It is our hope by Monday, April 13, the school will be distributing devices to those students in need of devices. Additionally, students will be allowed on campus during selected hours to access the internet in order to complete assignments. Of course, this access will not include entry into any of the buildings but while parked in our parking lots and practicing social distancing. As a last resort, paper “AMI Packets” will be distributed.

We recognize the current situation is less than ideal. Obviously, it is difficult for all of us. There remains many unanswered questions and no doubt this will continue into the coming weeks. I do know that our faculty is working very hard to reach every student with meaningful activities. As you might suspect, this is new for many of them as well. I think it critical as this point in time for all of us to be patient, understanding, prayerful, and thankful we reside in a community that truly cares for and supports one another. If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to call.
Aaron Hosman

div.class: custom_114471 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

p.span: It is the mission of the South Side School District in cooperation with parents and the community to educate all students in a non-threatening environment. All students will grow through education into lifelong achievers. We will provide a curriculum aligned with the state frameworks and national education goals. Teaching all students the extensive skills needed to acquire knowledge throughout life is this school’s purpose. Students will acquire the skills needed in order to function Tomorrow through the use of technology, higher order thinking skills, and positive character traits. This will be the driving force behind our school Today.

div.class: custom_125632 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

p.span: This reporting tool will allow parents and students to submit safety concerns that will help identify an individual that may hurt themselves or others or intervene in a situation that violates the school's policies. Please click the link below to complete the form.

div.class: custom_141401 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

p.span: The South Side School District continues to monitor the spread of COVID-19 or Coronavirus. School districts in Arkansas are receiving guidance from the Secretary of Health and the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education. The situation is changing daily and we are working diligently to safeguard our students. We will be posting our most current information on our website and Facebook page. I will encourage all of our parents to visit the school’s website and Facebook account to read the most recent information. If you have any question, please feel free to call the superintendent’s office.
Commissioner’s Memo LS-20-089 (Updated 3-11-2020)
Commissioner’s Memo LS-20-089 (Updated 3-12-2020)
